intro: Dyssochroma viridiflorum var. cuspidatum, commonly known as the green-flowered dyssochroma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while the stems are slender and somewhat woody. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
